titleStmt.title: Annexation Document
titleStmt.sponsor: Supported in part by a grant from the Wyoming Cultural Trust Fund, a program of the Department of State Parks and Cultural Resources.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

notesStmt.note: Following Horace C. Alger's death, this document served to transfer all of his rights, title, and interest in Cody, Wyoming, from his three sisters to E. B. Allan of Sheridan, Wyoming. Horace C. Alger's sisters were Mary J. Alger, Frances C. Alger, and Amanda M. Alger.

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, MS407 Bronson Rumsey Collection

div1.p: FOR VALUE RECEIVED, We, hereby sell, transfer, assign and convey to E. B. Allan1 all of our right, title and interest of any nature whatsoever in and to a one-fourteenth interest in the real estate upon which is located the Town-site of the Town of Cody, Wyoming, and any adjoining land included in a certain agreement between the Lincoln Land Company of Lincoln, Nebraska, and Bronson Rumsey, Trustee of Buffalo, New York, bearing date the 24th day of September, A. D. 1901, and meaning hereby to convey the entire interest of H. C. Alger, deceased, as represented by a certain trust agreement between, Wm. F. Cody, George T. Beck, Nathan Salsbury, George Bleistein, Horace C. Alger, H. Montgomery Gerrans and Bronson Rumsey as Trustee, bearing the date of 25th day of July, A. D. 1901.
In witness whereof we hereunto set our hands and seals this third day of January 1911
div1.closer:
Mary J. Alger
Frances C. Alger
Amanda M. Alger
Witness.
William E. Hutchins. to all

div1.p: I, William E. Hutchins a Notary Public in and for said County in the State aforesaid do hereby certify the Amanda M. Alger, Frances C. Alger and Mary J. Alger are personally known to me as the persons whose names are subscribed to the annexed instrument, appeared before me this day in person and acknowledged that they signed, sealed and delivered said instrument in writing as their free and voluntary act and deed.
My commission expires on the 15 th day of March 1916

back.note: Note 1: Erle B. Allan (1871-1952) worked his way through the ranks of the Bank of Commerce, Sheridan, Wyoming, to become the bank's president in 1930. Allan purchased the estate of H. C. Alger which included holdings in Cody, Wyoming.
